p: To further confirm that CPC disrupts the influenza virus envelope, we used ELISA to monitor the release of nucleoprotein from viruses in response to increasing concentrations of CPC. We found that exposure of virus to increasing concentrations of CPC (7.5, 10, and 20 μg/mL) resulted in significantly increased levels of viral nucleoprotein into the media supernatant ( P ≤ 0.05, Figure 4). The level of released nucleoprotein reached a plateau at CPC concentrations above 10 μg/mL. Taken together, these results demonstrate that CPC acts against influenza virus by rapid disruption of the viral envelope.
